quetzal.model.transportmodel module¶

class quetzal.model.transportmodel.TransportModel(json_database=None, json_folder=None, hdf_database=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: quetzal.model.preparationmodel.PreparationModel

step_assignment(volume_column='volume_pt', road=False, **loaded_links_and_nodes_kwargs)[source]¶
Assignment step
  • requires: links, pt_paths, road_links, road_paths, shares, nodes
  • builds: loaded_links, loaded_nodes, loaded_road_links
Parameters:loaded_links_and_nodes_kwargs – kwargs of engine.loaded_links_and_nodes

example:

sm.step_assignment(
    loaded_links_and_nodes_kwargs={
        'boardings': True,
        'alightings': True,
        'transfers': True
    }
)
step_build_los(build_car_skims=True, token=None, nb_clusters=20, skim_matrix_kwargs={})[source]¶
  • requires: pt_los
  • builds: los
Parameters:
  • build_car_skims – if True, the car_los matrix is build using Google API (if a valid token is given, a random matrix is generated otherwise). If False the current car_los matrix is used.
  • token – a token or list of tokens
  • nb_clusters – the number of clusters that will be build from the zoning. A single token allows only 2500 itineraries so 50 zones.
step_distribution(impedance_matrix=None, **od_volume_from_zones_kwargs)[source]¶
  • requires: zones
  • builds: volumes
Parameters:
  • impedance_matrix – an OD unstaked friction dataframe used to compute the distribution.
  • od_volume_from_zones_kwargs –

    if the friction matrix is not provided, it will be automatically computed using a gravity distribution which uses the following parameters: * param power: (int) the gravity exponent * param intrazonal: (bool) set the intrazonal distance to 0 if False,

    compute a characteristic distance otherwise.

  • requires: pt_paths, road_paths, volumes
  • builds: shares
step_modal_split(build_od_stack=True, **modal_split_kwargs)[source]¶
  • requires: volumes, los
  • builds: od_stack, shared
Parameters:modal_split_kwargs – kwargs of engine.modal_split

example:

sm.step_modal_split(
    time_scale=1/1800,
    alpha_car=2,
    beta_car=600
)
